alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marion and southern Putnam Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pomona Park, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Crescent City, Pomona Park, Fort McCoy, Lake Delancy, Sparr, Fruitland, Orange Springs, San Mateo, Satsuma and Welaka. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam
